artists.name: Depeche Mode

apple_music.copyright: ℗ 2001 Venusnote Ltd. under exclusive license to Sony Music Entertainment International Ltd
apple_music.editorial_notes: Twenty years into their career, having had to repair themselves after various personal crises, Depeche Mode have no right to sound this fresh and vital. However, Björk producer Mark Bell has encouraged them to experiment while maintaining their instinct for indelible hooks. Whether they’re pairing distorted beats with acoustic guitar loops (“Dream On”), stomping out sci-fi disco (“I Feel Loved”) or unfolding a lulling ballad (“When the Body Sleeps”), Exciter is an exquisite balance of unpredictability and warmth.

raw_attributes.copyright: ℗ 2001 Venusnote Ltd. under exclusive license to Sony Music Entertainment International Ltd

editorialNotes.short: The revitalised Mode’s 10th LP resets synth-pop’s boundaries.
editorialNotes.standard: Twenty years into their career, having had to repair themselves after various personal crises, Depeche Mode have no right to sound this fresh and vital. However, Björk producer Mark Bell has encouraged them to experiment while maintaining their instinct for indelible hooks. Whether they’re pairing distorted beats with acoustic guitar loops (“Dream On”), stomping out sci-fi disco (“I Feel Loved”) or unfolding a lulling ballad (“When the Body Sleeps”), Exciter is an exquisite balance of unpredictability and warmth.

raw_attributes.name: Exciter

wiki.content: Exciter is the tenth studio album by the English electronic band Depeche Mode, released on May 14, 2001. The album marks a notable point in the band's career as it showcases a shift in musical direction, highlighting their willingness to explore new sounds while retaining their distinctive essence. Released after a three-year hiatus, Exciter is characterized by its atmospheric and introspective quality. The album embraces a more minimalist approach, utilizing electronic textures, subtle rhythms, and lead singer Dave Gahan's emotive vocals to create an intimate and contemplative sonic landscape. The album features tracks like "Dream On," the lead single, which captures a blend of Depeche Mode's classic electronic sound with an updated feel. "I Feel Loved" and "Freelove" continue this theme while "Goodnight Lovers" closes the album with a reflective and poignant tone. While Exciter might not have achieved the same commercial success as some of Depeche Mode's earlier works, it remains a significant entry in their discography. The album's willingness to embrace experimentation and its focus on atmosphere over bombast showcase the band's evolution. The album reflects Depeche Mode's ability to evolve while staying true to their core essence. Its introspective lyrics, coupled with the band's signature sound, make it an essential chapter in their musical journey, resonating with listeners who appreciate its contemplative and textured approach to electronic music. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
